reqs:
Pre-reqs: All of ECON 101, ECON 102, MATH 105 and one of MATH 104, MATH 184.
Classes held in IONA301.
Classes held in IONA633
Classes held in IONA633
Classes held in IONA633
description: The aggregate economy with emphasis on macroeconomic policy and international economic growth, money and inflation, unemployment, business cycles, and macroeconomic stabilization policy under fixed and flexible exchange rates. Registration restricted to students in the Bachelor of International Economics Program. Credit will be granted for only one of ECON 302, 305, or 309.
